info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 8 at 9:46PM CDT until May 9 at 12:45AM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Fort Bend and Harris.
* WHEN...Until 1245 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 946 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northwestern Pasadena, Sugar Land, Missouri City, southeastern Rosenberg, Stafford, Bellaire, West University Place, Galena Park, Jacinto City, Astrodome Area, University Place, Greenway / Upper Kirby Area, Afton Oaks / River Oaks Area, Macgregor, Neartown / Montrose, Midtown Houston, Greater Third Ward, Fourth Ward, southeastern Memorial Park and Downtown Houston. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM CDT FRIDAY
